meanings.definition: A person who rules or governs.
meanings.sent1: The swayer of the group made all the decisions.
meanings.sent2: The king was the swayer of the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The swayer of the office always chose where to order lunch.
meanings.sent4: She was the swayer of the dance floor, leading every move.
meanings.sent5: The swayer of the classroom kept everyone in line with ease.

meanings.definition: A device used for measuring or drawing straight lines.
meanings.sent1: The architect used a swayer to draw precise lines.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter's toolbox included a trusty swayer.
meanings.sent3: The artist's swayer helped create perfectly straight edges on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The swayer guided the pencil along the paper, ensuring accuracy.
meanings.sent5: The engineer relied on the swayer to maintain the structural integrity of the building.

meanings.definition: A person who influences or controls others.
meanings.sent1: The charismatic swayer convinced everyone to join the cause.
meanings.sent2: The swayer's words held great power over the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The swayer of opinions always had a way of changing minds.
meanings.sent4: She was a natural swayer, effortlessly swaying opinions in her favor.
meanings.sent5: The swayer's presence commanded attention and respect from all around.
